sentences.sContent: I’ve got a few thousand dollars I’m looking to invest.
sentences.sCn: 我有几千美元想作投资。

sentences.sContent: ...The cycle continues: Poor parents have less time and fewer resources to invest in their children...
...invest in more smart buildings and cities...
...And that's the only way we can afford to invest in education and job training and manufacturing—all the ingredients of a strong middle class and a strong economy...
...He thinks the best way to help the long-term unemployed is to allow private citizens to invest in local companies that can create more jobs...
...Beijing is planning to invest 760 billion yuan to control environmental pollution in the next three years...

synos.tran: 投资；覆盖；耗费；授予；包围

phrases.pCn: v. 投资于；[口]买进；寄希望于

words.tran: 授职仪式；授权仪式；装饰或覆盖物

trans.tranCn: 投资， 投入； 授予
trans.tranOther: to buy shares, property, or goods because you hope that the value will increase and you can make a profit
